abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement plan has been prepared
            to ensure that unforeseen impacts, as a result of the Road
            Maintenance Program Project, be compensated in accordance to
            resettlement guidelines. In order to minimize resettlement,
            cash compensation will be provided for lost land at
            replacement cost, or market value for permanent loss of
            arable land, and, a minimum cash compensation, equivalent to
            ten percent value of the affected asset, will be paid for
            temporary loss of arable land. Residential land compensation
            will be paid in cash at replacement cost, or market value.
            Commercial land, where business premises are partially
            affected, will be compensated in cash at market value, and,
            structures partially affected will be compensated in cash
            for the affected portion/assets, including assistance in
            restoration of remaining structures. Crops affected by
            permanent/temporary land acquisition, will be compensated in
            cash at market value. Business and other income losses, will
            be compensated in cash, calculated on the basis of tax
            declaration per six months for permanent losses, while
            temporary losses will be calculated on the basis of tax
            declaration for the duration of the impact. Grievance
            mechanisms will be established to minimize potential
            resettlement problems.
